chat-portrait.form-hint: Open configuration window. Refreshes current page on save
chat-portrait.use-token-image-l: Use the actor's Token image instead of the actor's standard image.
chat-portrait.portrait-size-l: Configure portrait image size on the chat messages. Default is 36 px
chat-portrait.border-shape-l: Configure border shape of the portraits displayed on the chat messages. Setting this as None disables other border options
chat-portrait.user-color-as-border-color: Use Player Color for Portrait Border
chat-portrait.border-width-l: Configure portrait border width. Default is 2 px
chat-portrait.user-color-as-chat-border-: Use the actor's player's color for the border of the entire chat message
chat-portrait.user-color-as-chat-backgro: Use the actor's player's color for the background of the entire chat message
chat-portrait.flavor-next-to-portrait: Display Chat Flavor Text next to Portrait
chat-portrait.force-name-search-l: If there is no Actor matching with chat message data, search for an actor of which name corresponds to the message speaker's alias. This option is needed for the compatibility with Theatre Insert module.
chat-portrait.portrait-size-item-l: Configure portrait image size for any other image on the chat message (other than the portrait one). Default is 36 px
chat-portrait.settings.useTokenImage.hin: Use the actor's Token image instead of the actor's standard image.
chat-portrait.settings.doNotUseTokenImag: Do not use Token Image with  the following type of actors (e.g. character, npc, ecc. separate by character ',')
Remember the actor type is case sensitive. Make sense only with the setting 'Use Token Image' set to true
chat-portrait.settings.portraitSize.name: Portrait Size (px)
chat-portrait.settings.portraitSize.hint: Configure portrait image size on the chat messages. Default is 36 px
Configure portrait image size for any other image on the chat message (other than the portrait one). Default is 36 px
chat-portrait.settings.borderShape.name: Portrait Border Shape
chat-portrait.settings.borderShape.hint: Configure border shape of the portraits displayed on the chat messages. Setting this as None disables other border options
chat-portrait.settings.useUserColorAsBor: Use Player Color for Portrait Border
chat-portrait.settings.borderColor.name: Portrait Border Color
chat-portrait.settings.borderWidth.name: Portrait Border Width (px)
chat-portrait.settings.borderWidth.hint: Configure portrait border width. Default is 2 px
chat-portrait.settings.useUserColorAsCha: Use the actor's player's color for the background of the entire chat message
Use the actor's player's color for the border of the entire chat message
chat-portrait.settings.flavorNextToPortr: Display Chat Flavor Text next to Portrait
chat-portrait.settings.forceNameSearch.h: If there is no Actor matching with chat message data, search for an actor of which name corresponds to the message speaker's alias. This option is needed for the compatibility with Theatre Insert module.
chat-portrait.settings.hoverTooltip.name: Show hover tooltip instructions
chat-portrait.settings.hoverTooltip.hint: Show the token chat link instructions in a tooltip when hovering over a speaker's name.
chat-portrait.settings.textSizeName.name: Size of the name text on chat (px)
chat-portrait.settings.textSizeName.hint: Size of the name text on chat (px)
chat-portrait.settings.displaySetting.hi: Configure which message should receive custom styling, and which ones should be left as default. Changing this may require you to refresh your window.
chat-portrait.settings.displaySetting.ch: Affect own messages and GM messages.
chat-portrait.settings.useAvatarImage.hi: Use Avatar Player Image: Use the player's Token image instead of the token/actor standard image. Note if true ignore the first option if a avatar is found or else go back to the standard actor/token image feature.
chat-portrait.settings.displayUnknown.hi: Configure which message should use the unknown custom styling, and which ones should be left as default. Changing this may require you to refresh your window.
chat-portrait.settings.displayUnknown.ch: Affect own messages and GM messages.
Affect any messages done from a NPC (need a compatible system with the 'npc' type like D&D5).
chat-portrait.settings.displayUnknownPla: Placeholder for the label unknown Actor name
Placeholder for the label unknown Actor name by default is 'Unknown Actor' depends on the 'Display Unknown' setting
Placeholder for the label unknown item name
Placeholder for the label unknown item name by default is 'Unknown Item' depends on the 'Display Unknown' setting
Placeholder for the label unknown item icon
Placeholder for the label unknown item icon by default is '/modules/chat-portrait/assets/inv-unidentified.png' depends on the 'Display Unknown' setting
chat-portrait.settings.useTokenName.name: Use Token name
chat-portrait.settings.useTokenName.hint: If true force to use the actor's Token name instead of the actor's standard name.
chat-portrait.settings.displaySettingOTH: Display chat message of type OTHER
Configure custom styling for message of type OTHER
chat-portrait.settings.displaySettingOOC: Display chat message of type OOC
Configure custom styling for message of type OOC
Display chat message of type IC
Configure custom styling for message of type IC
chat-portrait.settings.displaySettingEMO: Display chat message of type EMOTE
Configure custom styling for message of type EMOTE
chat-portrait.settings.displaySettingWHI: Display chat message of type WHISPER
Configure custom styling for message of type WHISPER
chat-portrait.settings.displaySettingROL: Display chat message of type ROLL
Configure custom styling for message of type ROLL
chat-portrait.settings.displaySettingWhi: Display chat message of whisper to other
Configure custom styling for message of whisper to other
chat-portrait.settings.displayPlayerName: Shows the name of the player next to the name of the actor
Shows the name of the player next to the name of the actor for any IC messages
chat-portrait.settings.customStylingMess: Setup the custom styling for the current system.

Setup additional custom styling on message with CSS language based on the feedback of the community, Is A community effort for anyone don't know css language (note override any other prior property). If the settings 'Setup additional custom styling on the text chat message' or 'Setup additional custom styling on the image prepend the text chat message' is used (no blank text) this option even if true is ignored for the html elements involved.
Setup additional custom styling on the text chat message
Setup additional custom styling on the text chat message with CSS language (note override any other prior property)
Setup additional custom styling on the image prepend the text chat message
Setup additional custom styling on the image prepend the text chat message chat message with CSS language (note override any other prior property)
chat-portrait.settings.displayMessageTag: Adds a textual tag to chat messages
Adds a textual tag to chat messages to easily identify whether the message is a whisper, blind roll, or self roll next to the timestamp
Show textual tag, but next to name instead the timestamp
This settings make sense only with 'Adds a textual tag to chat messages' enabled, it till override the position of the tag and it will put next to the name instead to the timestamp of the chat
Some people do not like images from the Image Replacer now you can disable this function
chat-portrait.settings.useImageReplacerD: Use Image Replacer for Damage Type feature
Some people do not like images from the Image Replacer for Damage Type now you can disable this function
chat-portrait.settings.applyOnCombatTrac: Apply chat portrait on combat tracker
Apply the recovery of the image on the combat tracker. Note: if you are a GM and the combatant is not owned from a player the 'Use token image' is enabled anyway
chat-portrait.settings.applyPreCreateCha: Warning: if enable it try to correct some bug from midi-qol, cub, dnd5e helper ecc. but can cause incompatibility with other module.
chat-portrait.settings.disablePortraitFo: Disable the chat portrait if the alias of the chat message is from a GM
If enable every chat message done with a alias referenced to a GM will ot apply the chat portrait mechanism
chat-portrait.settings.setUpPortraitForA: Set up a specific image if the alias of the chat message is from a GM

If enable will use the image selected here for every chat message done with a alias referenced to a GM. If 'Disable the chat portrait if the alias of the chat message is from a GM' is enable this setting will be ignored
chat-portrait.setting.reset.name: Reset settings to default
chat-portrait.setting.reset.label: Reset Settings To Default
chat-portrait.setting.reset.hint: This will reset all of the settings of back to the active game system's default.
chat-portrait.setting.debug.name: Enable debugging
chat-portrait.setting.debug.label: Prints debug messages to the console
chat-portrait.dialogs.resetsettings.cont: Are you sure you want to reset all of the module settings to the current system's defaults? THIS CANNOT BE UNDONE!
chat-portrait.dialogs.nosystemfound.cont:
This system is not currently fully supported. This means that the module does not know how to best handle this system's items, but can still operate in a limited fashion.

You can configure the module's settings yourself, but it requires a bit of technical know-how.

If you have any questions, ping Wasp#2005 on the Foundry discord.
chat-portrait.dialogs.systemfound.title: System Recognized
chat-portrait.dialogs.systemfound.conten:
This system was previously not supported, but in an recent update it was added as a supported system!

Do you want to load this system's default Item Pile settings?
